text: Psalm 68
Praise to God for Providing Victory

For the \add music\add* director. Of David. A psalm. A song.\f + \fr Ps 68 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
God will arise; his enemies will be scattered,
and those who hate him will flee from before him.
As smoke is driven off, you will drive \add them\add* off.
As wax melts before fire,
\add the\add* wicked will perish before God.
But \add the\add* righteous will be glad; they will exalt before God,
and will rejoice with joy.
Sing to God, sing praises to his name.
Lift up \add a song\add* to \add the\add* rider on the clouds—his name is Yah—\f + \fr 68:4 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f*
and rejoice before him.
A father to orphans and a judge for widows
\add is\add* God in his holy habitation.
God settles the lonely in a home;
he brings prisoners out into prosperity.
But the rebellious abide in a barren land.
O God, when you went out before your people,
when you marched through \add the\add* desert, \qs Selah\qs*
\add the\add* earth shook; \add the\add* heavens also dripped \add rain\add*
at the presence of God who \add was\add* at Sinai,
at the presence of God, the God of Israel.
You caused abundant rain to fall, O God.
When your inheritance was weary you revived it.
Your community dwelled in it.
You provided in your goodness for the poor, O God.
The Lord gives \add the\add* word.
Great is the company of women who announce:
“\add The\add* kings of armies flee, they flee,
and she \add who\add* remains at home divides \add the\add* spoil.
Though you \add men\add* lie down between the sheepfolds,
\add you will be like the\add* wings of a dove covered in silver
and its pinions in yellow gold.”
When Shaddai scattered kings on it,
on Zalmon it snowed.\f + \fr 68:14 \ft Or “you caused it to snow on” \f*
A mountain of God\f + \fr 68:15 \ft Or “A mighty mountain” \f* \add is\add* the mountain of Bashan;
a mountain of \add many\add* peaks \add is\add* the mountain of Bashan.
Why do you look with hostility, O many-peaked mountains?
This\f + \fr 68:16 \ft Hebrew “The” \f* mountain God desires for his dwelling.
Yes, Yahweh will abide \add in it\add* forever.
The chariots of God
\add are\add* twice ten thousand, \add with\add* thousands doubled.
The Lord \add is\add* among them \add at\add* Sinai, distinctive \add in victory\add*.\f + \fr 68:17 \ft Or “\fq as at \ft Sinai, in the sanctuary” \f*
You have ascended on high; you have led away captives.
You have received gifts \add from\add* among humankind,
and even \add from the\add* rebellious, so that Yah\f + \fr 68:18 \ft A shortened form of “Yahweh” \f* God may dwell \add there\add*.
Blessed be the Lord. Daily he loads us \add with benefits\add*,\f + \fr 68:19 \ft Or “daily carries our burden” \f*
the God \add of\add* our salvation.\f + \fr 68:19 \ft Or “victory” \f* \qs Selah\qs*
Our God \add is\add* a God of deliverances,
and to \add the\add* Yahweh the Lord belong escapes from death.
But God will shatter the head of his enemies,
the hairy scalp \add of the one who\add* ⸤continues on⸥\f + \fr 68:21 \ft Literally “is walking about” \f* in his guilt.
The Lord said, “I will bring \add them\add* back from Bashan;
I will bring \add them\add* back from \add the\add* depths of \add the\add* sea,
so that your foot may shatter \add them\add* bloody
\add for\add* the tongues of your dogs \add to have\add* their share from \add the\add* enemies.”
They have seen your processions, O God,
the processions of my God, my king, distinctive \add in victory\add*.\f + \fr 68:24 \ft Or “into the sanctuary” \f*
Singers went up front, those playing stringed instruments last,
between \add them\add* young women \add playing\add* tambourines.
Bless God in \add the\add* assemblies,
Yahweh from the fountain of Israel.
There \add is\add* little Benjamin ruling them,
\add with\add* the princes of Judah \add in\add* their throng,
the princes of Zebulun \add and\add* the princes of Naphtali.
Your God has commanded your strength.
Show yourself strong, O God, \add by\add* what you perform\f + \fr 68:28 \ft Or “you who have worked” \f* for us.
Because your temple \add is\add* above Jerusalem,
kings will bring tribute to you.
Rebuke \add the\add* beasts in\f + \fr 68:30 \ft Hebrew “of” \f* \add the\add* reeds,
\add the\add* herd of bulls with \add the\add* calves of \add the\add* peoples,
trampling the pieces of silver.\f + \fr 68:30 \ft Or “\fq until each \ft humbles himself \fq by offering \ft pieces of silver” \f*
Scatter \add the\add* nations \add who\add* delight in battles.
Ambassadors\f + \fr 68:31 \ft Reading with the LXX; meaning uncertain \f* will come from Egypt;
Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.
O kingdoms of the earth, sing to God;
sing praise to \add the\add* Lord, \qs Selah\qs*
to the one who rides in the highest heavens of old.
See, he gives forth his voice, a mighty voice.
Ascribe strength to God.
His majesty \add is\add* over Israel,
and his strength \add is\add* in the clouds.
Awesome \add are you\add*, O God, from your sanctuary.\f + \fr 68:35 \ft Hebrew “sanctuaries” \f*
The God of Israel, \add it is\add* he who gives strength and might to the people.
Blessed be God.
